questions.prompt: In a parallel connection of two resistors, KVL forces:
options: A) The currents to be equal: i = i1 = i2
B) The voltages to be equal: v = v1 = v2
C) The resistances to be equal: R1 = R2
D) The powers to be equal: p1 = p2
questions.correctAnswer: B) The voltages to be equal: v = v1 = v2
questions.explanation: In a parallel connection, both elements share the same pair of nodes, so KVL forces v = v1 = v2.

questions.prompt: In a parallel connection, KCL gives:
questions.explanation: KCL at the common node gives i = i1 + i2. The port current is the sum of the individual branch currents.

questions.prompt: Two voltage-controlled resistors in parallel yield a result that is:
options: D) Depends on the specific functions
questions.explanation: Since v = v1 = v2 by KVL, i = i-hat1(v) + i-hat2(v) is a single-valued function of v. The result is voltage-controlled.

questions.prompt: Graphical parallel addition means, at each voltage value:
options: A) Add the voltages from each curve
B) Multiply the currents from each curve
C) Add the currents from each curve (vertical stacking)
D) Take the minimum of the currents
questions.correctAnswer: C) Add the currents from each curve (vertical stacking)
questions.explanation: Parallel addition adds currents at equal voltage. In the v-i plane, this is vertical stacking: at each horizontal position (voltage), add the heights (currents).
In the duality table, resistance R is dual to conductance G. The linear Ohm's law v = Ri becomes the dual i = Gv.

questions.prompt: The dual of a voltage source is:
questions.explanation: In the duality transformation, voltage sources become current sources, and vice versa.

questions.prompt: The dual of an open circuit is:
questions.explanation: An open circuit (i = 0 for all v) is dual to a short circuit (v = 0 for all i). The roles of zero current and zero voltage are swapped.

questions.prompt: The dual of 'series connection of current-controlled resistors is current-controlled' is:
options: A) Series connection of voltage-controlled resistors is voltage-controlled
B) Parallel connection of voltage-controlled resistors is voltage-controlled
C) Parallel connection of current-controlled resistors is current-controlled
D) Series connection is always better than parallel
questions.correctAnswer: B) Parallel connection of voltage-controlled resistors is voltage-controlled
questions.explanation: Apply the duality substitutions: series -> parallel, current-controlled -> voltage-controlled. The dual statement is: parallel connection of voltage-controlled resistors is voltage-controlled.

questions.explanation: Mesh and node are dual concepts. Mesh analysis (using KVL around loops with mesh currents) is dual to nodal analysis (using KCL at nodes with node voltages).
